Description: Fragment of a bottle in translucent dark blue and opaque white cameo glass. The decoration, in white on the outside, shows part of a pillar on a square base. The pillar is inscribed with horizontal lines and hieroglyphs. Below this are indeterminate elements forming, perhaps, part of a plinth. The pillar may be a Nilometer, used for measuring the changing water leveles of the Nile.
Bibliographic references: Tatton-Brown et al 2007 / Roman Cameo Glass (10)
Roberts et al 2010 / Roman Cameo Glass in the British Museum (20)
Glass 2 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass, Volume 2 (749)
Acquisition notes: Previously unregistered. Probably from Rome where Slade acquired most of his collection.
